name: salvific
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having the power or intention to save from danger, loss, or harm: The salvific importance of this discovery is plain to see. This way of thinking sees technology as socially salvific.
religion
  specialized (in the Christian religion) relating to the state of being saved from evil and its effects by the death of Jesus Christ: Christ's salvific mission is clearly laid out in the Gospels. the salvific message of the New Testament
